prompt: <description>Part 1: Construction of a Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom by following these steps: 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. a. Create a loop (loop_1) consisting of 4 linear curves (line_1, line_2, line_3, and line_4). b. The start point and end point of line_1 are [0.0, 0.0] and [0.5805, 0.0], respectively. c. The start point and end point of line_2 are [0.5805, 0.0] and [0.5805, 0.3326], respectively. d. The start point and end point of line_3 are [0.5805, 0.3326] and [0.0, 0.3326], respectively. e. The start point and end point of line_4 are [0.0, 0.3326] and [0.0, 0.0], respectively. 3. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.5805. 4. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by using the coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis using an extrusion depth of 0.2667 towards the normal direction and 0.0 in the opposite direction of the normal. Part 2: Construction of a Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom, and a Curved Side Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side by following these steps: 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.5805, 0.0588, 0.1051]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. a. Create a loop (loop_1) consisting of 6 curves, including 4 linear curves (line_1, line_2, line_5, and line_6) and 2 arcs (arc_1 and arc_2). b. The start point and end point of line_1 are [0.0, 0.0242] and [0.0243, 0.0], respectively. c. The start point and end point of line_2 are [0.0243, 0.0] and [0.1906, 0.0], respectively. d. The start point and end point of line_5 are [0.2024, 0.0565] and [0.0126, 0.0565], respectively. e. The start point and end point of line_6 are [0.0, 0.0439] and [0.0, 0.0242], respectively. f. Arc_1 starts at [0.215, 0.0439], has a midpoint at [0.2113, 0.0528], and ends at [0.2024, 0.0565]. g. Arc_2 starts at [0.0126, 0.0565], has a midpoint at [0.0037, 0.0528], and ends at [0.0, 0.0439]. 3. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.215. 4. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by using the coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis using an extrusion depth of 0.1695 towards the normal direction and 0.0 in the opposite direction of the normal.</description>
